revised_title: Analysis of Moira Brine Spring and Bromine Extraction
tldr: The author analyzes the Moira Brine Spring near Ashby-de-la-Zouch, Leicestershire, and investigates the extraction of bromine from the water. The spring water is used for medicinal baths and as a remedy for bronchocele and scrofulous tumors. The analysis reveals the presence of bromide of sodium and magnesium, chloride of calcium, protoxide of iron, and other elements.
